name: Instant Pot Vegan Enchilada Soup - Stovetop Option
description: Instant Pot Vegan Enchilada Soup with Quinoa, walnuts, mushrooms. Pressure Cooker Bean-free Vegan Quinoa Chili with Homemade Enchilada seasoning. Saucepan Option. Vegan Glutenfree Recipe. Soyfree Nutfree Oilfree option.

video.name: Instant Pot Vegan Enchilada Soup with Quinoa, Walnut, Mushroom ! Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Instant Pot Vegan Enchilada Soup with Quinoa, walnuts, mushrooms. 
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2018/11/instant-pot-enchilada-soup-vegan.html
MY BOOKS: https://veganricha.com/books 

This Pressure Cooker Bean-free "chikin" Enchilada Soup  has Homemade enchilada seasoning. Omit soycurls for soyfree and add more quinoa. Add some beans or chickpeas for a hearty Vegan Quinoa chili. 

Saucepan Option on the post. Vegan  Glutenfree Recipe. Soyfree Nutfree Oilfree option

Quinoa, mushrooms, walnuts, optional soy curls or beans/lentils all go into a pressure cooker with some enchilada seasoning, which is a dry enchilada sauce mix with various spices and chilies. Add some broth/stock and done! The quinoa and walnut add amazing texture to this thick soup which is more like a enchilada filling. You can use it to fill up burritos and top nachos too. If you add a bit more broth and some cooked beans, it makes a great Quinoa chili! Serve with toppings of choice.


Music by Lakey Inspired 

soundcloud.com/lakeyinspired

recipeIngredient: 1 tsp oil (, Or use 3 tbsp broth to saute)
6 oz mushrooms (, a combination or white, cremini or other))
2 tbsp or more enchilada seasoning ((see below))
1.5 cups veggie broth or vegan chikin flavored broth or water
3/4 tsp salt ((slightly less if the broth is salted))
1/2 tsp each of chipotle pepper powder (, ancho chili powder, cumin, oregano, chipotle pepper flakes, garlic powder, onion powder.)
3/4 tsp  smoked paprika (or a mix of sweet & smoked, as all smoked can be hot)

recipeInstructions.text: Start the instant pot on sauté. Add oil/broth. Once hot, add the onion, garlic and pinch of salt and cook for 2 minutes. Meanwhile, pulse the walnuts in a processor until they form a coarse mixture. Add mushrooms and pulse again until the mushrooms are chopped.
recipeInstructions.name: Start the instant pot on sauté. Add oil/broth. Once hot, add the onion, garlic and pinch of salt and cook for 2 minutes. Meanwhile, pulse the walnuts in a processor until they form a coarse mixture. Add mushrooms and pulse again until the mushrooms are chopped.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the mushroom and walnut mixture to the pot and mix in for a min. Add the jalapeño and peppers and cook for 2 mins.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the mushroom and walnut mixture to the pot and mix in for a min. Add the jalapeño and peppers and cook for 2 mins.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the spices, quinoa (or quinoa + soy curls)**, corn, salt, tomato sauce, broth and mix well.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the spices, quinoa (or quinoa + soy curls)**, corn, salt, tomato sauce, broth and mix well.

recipeInstructions.text: Close the lid and pressure cook on high pressure for 15 minutes, allow the pressure to release naturally. Taste and adjust the salt, heat or flavor and mix in.
recipeInstructions.name: Close the lid and pressure cook on high pressure for 15 minutes, allow the pressure to release naturally. Taste and adjust the salt, heat or flavor and mix in.

recipeInstructions.text: Garnish with vegan sour cream, lemon juice, cilantro, jalapeño or pickled jalapeño, and/or hot sauce. Serve with pumpkin cornbread.
recipeInstructions.name: Garnish with vegan sour cream, lemon juice, cilantro, jalapeño or pickled jalapeño, and/or hot sauce. Serve with pumpkin cornbread.

recipeInstructions.text: Saucepan: Follow steps 1,2 in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook the mushroom mixture for 3-4 mins before adding peppers. Follow step 3, Add 1/2 cup more broth and partially cover and cook for 20-25 minutes. Taste and adjust flavor, liquid content and check the quinoa for doneness. Uncover and simmer over low for 10 to 15 mins.
recipeInstructions.name: Saucepan: Follow steps 1,2 in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook the mushroom mixture for 3-4 mins before adding peppers. Follow step 3, Add 1/2 cup more broth and partially cover and cook for 20-25 minutes. Taste and adjust flavor, liquid content and check the quinoa for doneness. Uncover and simmer over low for 10 to 15 mins.

keywords: easy enchilada soup, instant pot enchilada soup, instant pot quinoa chili, quinoa chili, vegan quinoa chili
